12:35.race_name: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Badly out of sorts again last week; returns to hurdling for first time since March 2023
runners.name: Inis Oirr
runners.spotlight: 3m7f Edinburgh National winner; having lost his way last season, he lost out narrowly (3m, good) on October reappearance but has gone badly the wrong way again since; returns to hurdling for first time since March 2023; last wore today's cheekpieces that December and has had other headgear since; whether these changes will relight his fire remains to be seen.

stable_tour.quote: We changed tactics at Carlisle the other day and it worked wonders as he was probably getting a bit sick of being bullied out in front. We're thinking of going for another Edinburgh National as he's got to go right-handed. He seems much more back to himself. 29-10-25

runners.breeder: Dr V Ana Sofia Dias Trindade & Tim Lane
runners.comment: Won over about 2m4f in his two handicaps; tapped for toe turning for home last time
runners.name: Nazare
runners.spotlight: Won over about 2m4f on good to soft at Market Rasen and Southwell (by a neck) last month in his only two handicaps; raised another 4lb and in trip after he was tapped for toe turning for home last time and also met trouble in running; could easily have more to give.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in all three of his bumpers and then we gave him some experience over hurdles on his final start at Newbury last season. Fourth on his comeback at Fontwell on Thursday, he'll be a nice novice hurdler over two and a half miles-plus. 24-10-25
He's a nice horse by Masterstroke. He was second on his debut in a bumper at Southwell in early December and runs at Huntingdon on Thursday in another bumper. 01-01-25

runners.comment: In-form candidate; should be seriously involved but a bit bit extra may now be needed.
runners.name: Kiss My Face

prev_owners.owner: D Gilbert, M Lawrence, A Bruce

runners.spotlight: Ran well on his only appearance at this track (last season); nothing to prove stamina-wise and he followed his win at Wetherby in October with good runs at Bangor and Warwick; should be seriously involved again but a bit bit extra may now be needed.

stable_tour.quote: Bought for a bit of summer fun and he's done very well. He's only won once but he's gone up the handicap very quickly. 19-02-25

runners.comment: No impact in handicaps but there was clear encouragement last time for this longer trip
runners.name: Guchen

prev_owners.owner: This Horse Is For Sale Partnership

runners.spotlight: Going handicapping under 10lb claimers at about 2m4f/2m5f in his three starts this season has not brought any advances, but there was clear encouragement last time for this longer trip.

runners.comment: 2nd or 3rd all starts under rules; handicap debut and new trip could both be a help
runners.name: Douglas Hyde
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who finished runner-up in three soft-ground bumpers and has been third at Bangor (2m, good) and Chepstow (near 2m4f, soft; made most) in his two hurdle races; needs better but handicap debut and new trip could both be a help.

stable_tour.quote: I really like him. He was beaten last time at Ffos Las but I heard after the race from the Skeltons that the winner Giantsgrave worked around Newbury with The New Lion, so they rate him pretty highly. We were beaten by a good one but I think he could potentially be very nice. The ground was disgusting at Ffos Las, he was quite gassy and he did well to finish as he did. He's one of the best jumpers I've ever seen. I can't wait to see him again and he'll stay well. We'll try to win a bumper as Ben Jones said he'd win one when he came off him last time. He'll be out in a few weeks. 10-02-25

runners.comment: Won this (soft) last year; 6lb lower today, off 181 days and yard back among the winners
runners.name: Clondaw Royale

quotes.race: Thank You John Burgess Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clondaw Royale is a really nice horse and I'm delighted to get that win with him. The further he went, the better he got. Hopefully, he'll be a nice stayer in the future - James Smith, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won well in this race (soft) last year under Benjamin Macey; 6lb lower today, following the grim results on his last four outings but they were on good ground and his stable is now back among the winners, so he could conceivably be back with a bang after his 181 days off if the ground is okay.

runners.comment: Back near her best when second at Hexham on latest start; each-way candidate
runners.name: Maura Jeanne
runners.spotlight: Has proven stamina; last season saw the only two wins of her 26-race hurdle career and she was back near her best when second at Hexham in early November on latest start; each-way candidate.

13:05.race_name: Betfred 'Bet Builder' EBF 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Easily justified favouritism at Market Rasen; can do better but this is a stronger race
runners.name: Brixson

quotes.race: Pertemps Network 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Andrew Lynch schools them all over in Ireland, but the person that gets them ready over there is Claire O'Connell and they both deserve a mention alongside Joel and Sue. The mare of this lad had bred four winners. We keep her over in Ireland and that seems to work well. We knew we had a great chance coming here today. Gavin (Sheehan) just kept it simple as he rode Brixson last time. I suspect we will find another one of these types of races next. - Tom Ford, co-owner

runners.spotlight: Fell on hurdles debut but runner-up at Wetherby (2m, good) on reappearance and easily justified favouritism at Market Rasen (2m1f, good to soft) five weeks ago; can still do better but faces much stronger opposition today.

runners.comment: Turned over at 4-6 at Aintree (2m1f, soft) but he's still one of the leading contenders
runners.name: Captain Hugo

quotes.race: Agetur UK 40th Anniversary In Business Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: On paper, it was going to take some winning, but I was very happy with Captain Hugo at home. I knew he'd come on mentally, if not physically, and I'm chuffed with how he's started his hurdling career. We'll look at slightly bigger targets now - Johnson White, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a bumper at Worcester (2m, good) in May and on hurdle debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November; turned over at 4-6 in a three-runner race at Aintree (2m1f, soft) this month but it was probably a creditable show and he's one of the leading contenders in this line-up.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with his win at Newbury and we can look to go over further than two miles with him if we need to. We'll let him tell us what to do in terms of trip and we'd like to go in another ordinary novice hurdle before we step him up in class. On the evidence of Newbury he could be a smart novice hurdler this season. 20-11-25

runners.comment: 12l win in maiden at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) on yard debut; tended to jump to his left
runners.name: The Cistercian
runners.spotlight: Irish promise on good ground this summer was followed by a 12l win in maiden hurdle at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) three weeks ago for new yard, coming from off the pace to lead before two out; lots to like in that performance and he tended to jump to his left, so switching to this way round should help; firmly in the picture.

runners.comment: 17-2 from 14-1 for a maiden at Southwell (2m, good to soft) 16 days ago but always behind
runners.name: Boston Savr
runners.spotlight: Closely related to useful Irish hurdler Crosshill; 17-2 from 14-1 for a maiden hurdle at Southwell (2m, good to soft) 16 days ago but always behind; hard to fancy just yet, despite his stable's recent winners.

runners.comment: Some promise but needs to improve his jumping and looks much more of a handicap prospect
runners.name: Gaelic Glow
runners.spotlight: Some promise in his two bumpers and two hurdle races but he needs to improve his jumping and looks much more of a handicap prospect.

stable_tour.quote: He showed ability in two bumpers for Tom Weston and is still a big frame of a horse, so he'll have no pressure on him in novice hurdles this season. He should make a nice staying chaser in time. 29-10-25

runners.comment: 4th of six at Leicester (1m7f, soft) last time was better but he needs to find vastly more
runners.name: Golden Prince
runners.spotlight: Third in an Irish point and soundly beaten in a Chepstow bumper; while his fourth of six at 50-1 in a novice hurdle at Leicester (1m7f, soft) last time was better, he still needs to find vastly more.

runners.comment: Has some ability and his sights are lowered but others are a bit more solid
runners.name: The Egyptian Ginge
runners.spotlight: Ridden all starts by Jamie Neild; went close at Ludlow in April in his third bumper; last of five when 40-1 in 4yo event at Cheltenham (2m, good; made the odd mistake) on hurdling debut in October appeared to be much better form, which he failed to back up over C&D (good to soft) last month but that was in a Grade 2; sights lowered but others are a bit more solid.

runners.comment: Irish point win; bit promise in both hurdles starts but others have accomplished much more
runners.name: Timmys Jet Away
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point in May on debut; had wind surgery before showing a bit promise over hurdles at Doncaster (2m, soft) and Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) but others have accomplished much more; stable runs three.

runners.comment: £55,000 buy after Irish point win; neither hurdles start gives him form serious claims
runners.name: U S Marshall
runners.spotlight: Bought for £55,000 after Irish point win; third at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) on hurdle debut was better than his Carlisle run (2m3f, soft) 16 days ago, but neither gives him serious form claims just yet; stable runs three.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely chasing type who won an Irish point-to-point and finished third over hurdles on his debut last week. We might get him qualified for the EBF final - he's a really nice horse. He's going to need further as he's very backward. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Second in a maiden at Hereford (2m, good to soft; 28-1) on yard debut puts him in the mix
runners.name: Wolf Walker
runners.owner: Robert Fear And Mrs Tracey Ham
runners.spotlight: 0-3 in Irish points but 3-3 in British version; well beaten in a Cheltenham hunter chase (3m2f, soft) in May 2024 on final start for Christopher Barber but, dropped in trip with a tongue-tie added, his stable/hurdling debut three weeks ago saw a much better display when second of 12 in a maiden at Hereford (2m, good to soft; 28-1); that puts him in the mix.

runners.comment: 15l defeats in both starts over hurdles; needs transformation with today's first-time hood
runners.name: Moonlightinthepark
runners.spotlight: Second her only Irish point; 15l defeats over hurdles at Wetherby (2m, soft) and Ludlow (2m good to soft) showed some ability but she still needs a transformation with today's first-time hood; yard runs three.

13:35.race_name: Betfred 'The Classic Bookmaker' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Scea Pa Ouvry & Ecurie Des Vives Terres
runners.comment: Lightly-raced 9yo; won a chase in 2022; has been hurdling last 2 seasons; on a good mark
runners.name: Lac De Constance

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lac De Constance is very good and we have always thought that. He was a little bit keen in his bumpers and that is why we had to look after him and then he went novice hurdling. I didn't chuck him into the deep end but I did give him a couple of tests but it was all about making him into the best chaser he could be. I think if the Wayward Lad came up soft he would be a strong consideration for such a race - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I don't think Lac De Constance would have come off the bridle had Paddy's (Brennan) not made the mistake three out as I was cantering away. He is a good horse. We will have to look after him. Today was perfect on soft ground on a slow track. Hopefully, he could be quite good - Harry Skelton, rider.

quotes.race: Get Daily Tips At racingtv.com Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lac De Constance had some good form in bumpers. We've given him plenty of time and done his wind. Hopefully we can go on from there, he won quite impressive and Harry [Skelton] said he gave him a lovely feel. He's always shown plenty at home-  Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 9yo; only win in five runs over fences was in a three-runner Kempton novice in November 2022 (2m2f, soft); has been over hurdles for the last two seasons and on both starts this term; well beaten last try over fences in March 2023 (2m, soft) but 14lb lower now.

stable_tour.quote: A very talented horse but things haven't gone smoothly for him. It looked as though things were going right for him at Uttoxeter last month until he fell at the last, but I'm sure he'll get back to winning form soon enough, although we'll wait for softer ground. Once we get him back on track I think you'll see a progressive horse. 12-11-24

runners.comment: All wins, including at Kelso in November, at around 2m; not so good latest; 2m4f a worry
runners.name: Grain Doudairies
runners.spotlight: All five wins have been at around 2m, the most recent at Kelso in November (2m1f, good to soft; won by 15l); not so good stepped up to 2m24f last time; stamina doubts remain.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Doncaster last November and was full of running at Wetherby when he had the most horrendous fall. In Carlisle's Go North final, he probably would have won if he hadn't missed the last. That's just him - he's got that in him. He wants two-mile handicaps round the big tracks. I've always thought there's a decent chase in him when it all clicks. 30-10-25

He is a lovely horse who made a very pleasing start to his career when a close third in a Hereford bumper last spring. This season we gave him his first run over hurdles at Bangor in November where he was a nice seven-length winner. Unfortunately, he has had a little setback since, but he is back in work again and we are trying to get him back. he is a big horse who can be quite hard on himself, and he takes a bit of managing. We will stick to hurdles for now but next season he could evolve into a decent northern handicapper on soft ground. 09-02-23

runners.comment: Four chase wins including this race in 2024; back after wind op and a contender
runners.name: Ned Tanner
runners.spotlight: Has won four times over fences including this race off a 7lb lower mark last year; won off today's mark at Ayr in March (2m4f, soft) but below best both starts this season; returns after having a wind op; contender

stable_tour.quote: He ran a very nice race at Kelso on Saturday but just got a little bit tired. He missed some work after a wind operation in September and it was a very strongly run race, which just caught him out in the closing stages. The handicapper has dropped him to 114 and he's won off higher than that. I haven't got a race in mind but I think he can rate higher. Although he's won plenty of races, I still think he can compete at a higher level. He travelled very well at Kelso considering the pace they went and that the ground was a bit quick. He stays very well too. 21-11-24

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Best form at around 2m; well beaten on reappearance; headgear now tried; bit to prove
runners.name: Bois Guillbert

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm really pleased. Bois Guillbert is made to jump fences and he's always jumped them better than he does hurdles when we've schooled him - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Best form has been at around 2m; only chase win a four-runner 2m handicap at Newcastle in February (good to soft); well beaten behind Grain d'Oudairies on reappearance at Kelso (2m1f, good to soft) but should improve for the run; now tried in cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: He was a junior hurdle graduate last season and two miles suits for now. He's already finished third at Perth this season and he'll go for another hurdle race next, but we want to go chasing soon. 30-10-24

We make quite an effort to buy nicely bred two-year-olds in France as it's our way of getting a quality horse who's not oven-ready and most importantly offers some value against the big spenders. This fellow was here in training from the age of two and made a very pleasing start to his jumping career when successful in a junior hurdle at Ayr last month. Those races are a great innovation for the young horses and the beauty is that having won one of them he's still a novice next season. They have the penalties for winning but most importantly they have a handicap mark. This fellow will have another run at Wetherby at the start of March and then he'll have a nice long summer holiday before coming back as a novice hurdler next season. 25-01-23

runners.comment: Newcastle winner in November; pulled up in other 3 of his last four runs; hard to predict
runners.name: Taras Halls
runners.spotlight: Capable but not particularly reliable; won in first-time blinkers (retained) at Newcastle in November (2m4f, good to soft) but has been pulled up on the other three of his last four starts and is hard to predict.

runners.breeder: Brittas House Stud And Grenane House
runners.comment: Quite useful at best; runner-up on second chase start last time; well treated; possible
runners.name: Bowenspark

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.spotlight: Quite a useful bumper horse and hurdler; has run only twice over fences, pulling up on first occasion but last time finishing second at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) when headgear was dispensed with (left off again); well treated on his best form and could go well.

runners.comment: 2m hurdle winner last term; disappointing since; stamina to prove on her chase debut
runners.name: Epinephrine
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' handicap hurdle at Kempton last February (2m, good to soft); went up 9lb and has been disappointing on both starts since, including when stepped up to 2m5f at Warwick on reappearance (good to soft); has her stamina to prove on her first run over fences.

stable_tour.quote: She was a bit in and out last season but she's going well at the moment and I hope she can add to her win at Kempton. She'll start back over hurdles but will go over fences at some stage. Hopefully she's more consistent with another year on her back. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Ex-French hurdles winner; bit to prove as a chaser but open to improvement; could go well
runners.name: Kahavari
runners.spotlight: Quite useful over hurdles, only win coming over 2m3f on soft ground in France in September 2024; unseated his rider on first run over fences and was then disappointing on testing ground last time (2m1f); open to improvement.

stable_tour.quote: The French horses don't normally do that well in the same season they come over, but he was second twice and could be quite nice. He was going very easily at Bangor last week when unseating his rider and it was just unfortunate. He'll be winning soon and should have some better targets coming up. 20-11-25

14:05.race_name: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Qual') (GBB)

runners.comment: Dual hurdle/bumper winner; fair third on chase debut; suited by plenty of give; contender
runners.name: Sole Solution

quotes.race: Dragonbet The Bookmaker Of Wales National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 2 Elim') (GBB) (Conditional/Amateurs)
quotes.quote: Sole Solution has replicated the form of his full brother Easy As That who won two bumpers, including here. He's a big horse and he should be a nice horse for Sir John Timpson - Venetia Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle/bumper winner on soft/heavy ground; creditable third at Uttoxeter on chase debut (heavy; first run at 3m; 1.25l behind runner-up Ski Lodge); should improve for the run; contender.

stable_tour.quote: I'm looking forward to him going chasing this season because he's always looked like the type to do well over fences. He looks like a chaser, so to win two bumpers and two races over hurdles was a bonus. He needed all of the two and a half miles in heavy ground to win at Sandown on his last start and ultimately he's a three-miler. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Fair staying hurdler; creditable fourth on chase debut (form sound); one with a chance
runners.name: I Wish You

quotes.race: Whitehall Turret Club Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: I Wish You was beaten by three of our horses. I never felt he was ungenuine or anything, he just wants further and to mature a bit. He was recommended and wasn't expensive, and the owners have been very good to us. We bought him as a two-year-old and it's very rewarding when you've kept them that long and they come through. I feel like there's a lot of progress in him and I think he's a chaser - Peter Scudamore, trainer's assistant.

runners.spotlight: Developed into a fair stayer over hurdles, best recent run when second at Perth in October (3m, soft); fair fourth at Kelso on chase debut (2m7f, soft; cheekpieces tried); that form sound as the third and fifth were second and first at Wetherby on Saturday; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite coltish but got loads of experience in those junior races. He finished second a lot but it was because he was a little bit weak. He knows how to win, as he proved on his hurdles debut this month. I can't wait for him to go chasing. 30-10-24

runners.comment: Hurdles/bumper winner; creditable second on chase debut; should go well again
runners.name: Ski Lodge
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate - Ski Lodge
runners.spotlight: Hurdles/bumper winner on soft/heavy; creditable second at Uttoxeter on chase debut (3m, heavy; Sole Solution 1.25l back in third); should go well again.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, fine horse who won a bumper at Chepstow and was going to run again in the spring but scoped badly and then the ground went against him. He's schooled well and will go straight over hurdles. He'll probably start at two and a half miles but will get three. He could be a decent novice. 25-10-24

He was disappointing on his hurdling debut at Ffos Las but won nicely at Haydock. He picked up a little injury, which meant he missed the middle part of the season, but he was back ready to run at the start of March. The ground dried up, though, so we didn't get a chance to run him again. He's an unexposed type who is going chasing. 22-10-25

runners.breeder: Ecurie Nicolas Taudon & M Joel Poitou
runners.comment: Point/hurdle winner; not won, for nearly four years but a capable performer and a possible
runners.name: Gold Emery
runners.spotlight: Winning Irish pointer in December 2021 (3m, yielding to soft); won over 2m1f at Carlisle on hurdles debut (heavy) in February 2022 but hasn't won since, although plenty of good placed efforts, including on both starts this term; a possible,

stable_tour.quote: He's a very well-handicapped chaser. We tried a couple of better races off a light weight and he ran well in them. He likes Haydock and heavy ground, and those are the races for him. 12-11-24

runners.comment: 3m h'cap hurdle winer; off the mark over fences at Newcastle latest; 5lb higher; chance
runners.name: Paddy Omahler

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Paddy O'Mahler has done nothing wrong, he finished second on his last two runs over fences and it's good to get his head in front today - Danny McMenamin, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won a 3m handicap hurdle off a 13lb lower mark at Wetherby in February (3m, soft); has run creditably on all three starts over fences, getting off the mark in a 2m7f handicap at Newcastle last time (good to soft; cheekpieces back on); headgear retained and chance off 5lb higher mark.

14:35.race_name: Betfred 'Goals Galore' EBF Junior 'National Hunt' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: By Teofilo; clear 2nd on Bangor debut; last of six in Listed event next time; a possible
runners.name: Diamond Jim
runners.spotlight: By Teofilo; clear second to a subsequent winner on Bangor debut in November (2m, soft) but last of six when stepped up to Listed company at Aintree next time (2m1f, soft); wouldn't rule out.

runners.comment: Good 2nd on Cork debut, but struggled to score on stable debut latest; better expected
runners.name: Lucy The Wire
runners.owner: A Keaveney, M Keaveney & P Butcher
runners.spotlight: Promising second to a subsequent winner on debut at Cork in October (2m1f, good; 40-1) when with Denis Hogan; subsequently changed yards and made hard work of landing odds of 4-7 in a mares' event in bad ground on stable debut at Leicester last time; better than that last run and has a chance.

runners.comment: French-bred; winning debut in Newcastle bumper; interesting contender on hurdles debut
runners.name: Majordomo
runners.spotlight: French-bred who was bought for 30,000 euros in July 2024; made a winning debut in a Newcastle bumper in November (2m1f, good to soft); interesting on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: 95,000 euros 2yo; fourth to Majordomo in bumper on debut; should improve on jumps debut
runners.name: Marvel Magic
runners.spotlight: 95,000 euros 2yo; 2-1 favourite for Newcastle bumper on debut, but could finish only 4.5l fourth to stable companion Majordomo who meets him on the same terms; likely improver on jumps debut

runners.comment: 8.25l fourth in Huntingdon on debut; may fare better now going over hurdles
runners.name: Pippins Legend
runners.spotlight: By Passing Glance; beaten 8.25l when fourth in a Huntingdon bumper on his debut; should improve; jumps debut.

runners.comment: Well beaten third on debut, but has since had wind op; tongue-tie tried; better expected
runners.name: Playful Fox
runners.spotlight: Has had a wind operation since finishing a well-beaten third at Bangor on his debut; has 16l to make up with runner-up Diamond Jim but no surprise were he to run better with tongue-tie now tried.

runners.comment: Clear of the others when 12l second to previous winner on Doncaster debut;  should improve
runners.name: The Grayster
runners.spotlight: Well clear of the remainder when 12l second to a previous winner at Doncaster on debut last month; should improve; one to consider.

15:05.race_name: Betfred Last Fling Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Des Marais
runners.comment: Doesn't always spark but he stays all day and is very much the class act at this level
runners.name: Vanillier

quotes.race: Ladbrokes P.P. Hogan Memorial Cross Country Chase
quotes.quote: Vanillier has really sharpened up of late. The blinkers helped. He really enjoyed that. He's entered in the National and he has the option of the Cross Country at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was really nice. I probably found myself too far back, but Vanillier is a really strong stayer and he stayed on all the way to the line - Sean Flanagan, jockey.

quotes.race: Liam & Valerie Brennan Florida Pearl Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: On the whole Vanillier jumped very well. I would have liked it if something had joined him earlier in the race just to force a bit more pace into it, but he's just a dour stayer. I walked the track beforehand and it's nice, safe ground. Hopefully he'll be okay in the morning. He's a big, lazy type of horse who wants to get his toe in. There's the two staying novice chases at Leopardstown and Limerick this Christmas. He'll get an entry for both and, ground depending, a decision will be made closer to the time. He's a big horse and we want to mind him in terms of the ground - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered as The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I watched the race with Jonathan (Moore, injured regular rider) and he said the last day he couldn't even get him to line up at Leopardstown and here he had his ears pricked and he bounced out the gate. It's tough for Johnny, but the good thing is he'll be back on these horses and they're young horses so hopefully they have a bright future. Vanillier is a proper staying chaser in the making, to what level he can go I'm not sure but he's a lovely big horse - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a three mile chaser for next season. I didn't think he'd be able to win a maiden hurdle up until recently but he's improved a lot. He's entitled to step up in grade after that - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.spotlight: Second in the 2023 Grand National; also ran well when 18l winner over the banks course at Punchestown in February and third in the Cheltenham cross-country in March; the fire in his belly seems to be absent on more occasions these days, but last month's run should have helped with his fitness and he's very much the class act at this level.

stable_tour.quote: He took to cross-country chases well last season, finishing third behind Stumptown at the festival, and the plan is to run in the cross-country race at Cheltenham's November meeting. He'll be aimed at the festival again in March. He's been a great horse for us and has been unlucky in big races on occasions. 04-11-25
He has an entry in the cross-country at Cheltenham on Friday and we're going to give that a shot. Hopefully that will spark him up. I wouldn't rule out going back to the Grand National. 13-11-24

runners.comment: This trip is worth a go; competitive mark if all's well for this seasonal/stable debut
runners.name: Egbert

quotes.race: Betfred Tommy Whittle Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I couldn't have Egbert on the (heavy) ground, but he kept on plugging on in there. He got a new lease of life turning in and really came alive for me. He was brave at the last and the longer we went, the better he went. He's got all the ability. Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Egbert has done that before when he won at Ludlow as he didn't travel down the far side there, but at home he travels with great fluency. His schooling has been very good and he works like a good horse at home. When he won at Ludlow I then ran him afterwards on deep ground and he hated that. I did his wind at the end of the season and I actually fancied him today but I didn't expect him to travel that bad. He certainly won't be coming back in trip and he will get three miles before he is finished - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won well over Haydock's extended 3m1f on heavy ground last December off 3lb lower; failed to complete in his three marathon chases but they were over 4m-4m2f and he'll probably get this trip; has since left Alan King (same owners); trainer has had recent winners and this 8yo has a competitive mark if all's well for this seasonal/stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a progressive novice chaser last season, although he probably found the Scottish Grand National one step too much. He's come back in good form and will be ready to go at the start of November. He'll be campaigned in staying chases and should be competitive away from the very top level. 25-10-24

The Scottish Grand National was a step too far but otherwise he was progressive last season. He's returned in good form and could start off at Exeter on Friday. He'll be campaigned in staying chases and should be competitive away from the top level. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Partial recovery with cheekpieces on last two starts; 3lb below his last winning mark
runners.name: Whistle Stop Tour
runners.owner: Mrs Jo Tracey, K Alexander, P&S Bryceland

quotes.race: Karaoke At The Golf Inn Prestwick Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Whistle Stop Tour is a really progressive 7yo and Derek [Fox] was really positive about him after his Kelso win. He has plenty of options open to him. There's the 3m6f novice handicap chase at Cheltenham, there's a nice race at Uttoxeter soon after or there's always the Scottish National back here. Our dream though would be the 2026 Grand National - Sean Tracey, joint-owner, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Won two in a row last winter (2m7f/3m, soft) but went off the boil; there's been a partial recovery with cheekpieces enlisted on his last two starts this term, admittedly beaten 17l here on latest, so much better is required, but he's now 3lb below his last winning mark.

stable_tour.quote: He ran some big races last year before everything went wrong in the Ultima when he was nearly brought down. We tried to rescue the season after that, but he's come back in great form. He looks so much stronger and you'd like to think he'd be a type who could build into a Scottish National horse. He stays very well. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Pulled up both starts last season; absent 374 days since and had wind surgery in September
runners.name: Regal Blue

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regal Blue might be one for the Midlands National next year. He jumps and stays and is very honest. The ground is important for him as he needs it soft - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Regal Blue really enjoyed conditions whereas others probably didn't. You have to be tough on this ground and that's one thing he is - Nick Scholfield, rider.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At Vickers.Bet Everyday Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Regal Blue did nothing wrong and was highly regarded by Tom Malone, so credit to him - Nick Scholfield, rider.

runners.spotlight: Two heavy-ground wins two seasons back included one at this track but he was inconsistent in that campaign and pulled up on both starts last season; absent 374 days since and had wind surgery in September; well handicapped if he's back on song for his resurgent yard.

stable_tour.quote: He's had his wind tweaked which might help him, but the key to this horse is attritional conditions. He's still lightly raced and we'll wait until the ground is bottomless. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Not proven over this far (one attempt in Ireland) and others are a touch more persuasive
runners.name: Wa Wa

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Home Builders Supporting St. Mary's GAA Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Wa Wa stays well, the further he went the better. He liked the ground and kept going, he will go further going forward and is going the right way - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer

runners.spotlight: 10yo who had an extensive career in Ireland before joining this yard for 2025; won over hurdles at Perth (3m2f, good to soft) in April and third over fences on last two outings but he's not proven over this far (one attempt in Ireland) and others are a touch more persuasive.

runners.breeder: Mme M Hanquiez, Mr G Hanquiez & Earl L
runners.comment: Won at Warwick (3m, soft) latest; 13lb higher (4lb out of handicap) but finding his feet
runners.name: Jupiter Des Bordes
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo who has run in six races in Britain, all handicap chases; best effort when winning by a head under Charlie Maggs at Warwick (3m, soft) 19 days ago and the close second had a wide-margin win eight days later; 13lb higher today and 4lb of that is due to being out of the handicap, but this new trip holds possibilities and he's now finding his feet.

runners.comment: Won three two seasons ago; highly tried since; fair run latest; interesting down in grade
runners.name: Brentford Hope

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance. It was a very good ride because we planned to make the running but they went very hard. Holly was nearly running him down but Brentford Hope looked in control of the race the whole way - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness St Patrick's Day Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Brentford Hope has been good for me. He's the first horse I've trained to win four races, which is cool. He got an easy lead and I thought he was always going to win. He had a nice untroubled run around and it was lovely. We won't go back to the Swinton Hurdle as the ground was too quick last year, but he has a few options. There's definitely still mileage in him this season ? he's not earned a holiday yet! - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Brentford Hope got his ground. He didn't get the ground at Windsor last time where it was more good and, jumping into a Listed race on his first run of the year, he was going flat out the whole way. Today was only soft and the heavier the ground, the better. We'll go wherever he'll get his ground. In a really good race, he'd have to have really bad ground, but he was stuffed in a Listed race at Windsor so don't get carried away. He's won on soft ground on the bridle, but he's a bridle horse and there weren't six more lengths hidden under Jamie's hands there. He does everything on the bridle and when it's really soft ground, it suits those horses. We'll duck and dive throughout the year and look for our ground and there'll be an entry in the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes on Champions Day as some years the ground is that bad he could be placed in it - Richard Hughes, trainer.

quotes.race: Coates & Seely Brut Reserve Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: In the last month the pace Brentford Hope started showing me was unbelievable. I knew he'd stay but with the pace he was showing me lately I thought he must be a good horse - Richard Hughes, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressed really well two seasons ago, winning three times and going up 18lb in the ratings; has faced some stiff tasks and hasn't fared as well since, including in two chases; fair sixth at Cheltenham back over hurdles last time and an interesting contender down in grade.

stable_tour.quote: He's tough to place now because he's done so well over hurdles, but he ran well when fourth at Cheltenham on his chasing debut last weekend and jumped very nicely. He'll go for a beginners' chase on soft ground. 19-11-25

His pre-Christmas target is the Gerry Feilden for second-season novices at Newbury on Winter Carnival weekend. Everything went to plan for him until the Swinton Hurdle at Haydock, where he didn't really let himself go. Paul O'Brien felt he was never really in the race after his two novice hurdle wins. We were trying to get him ready for the Balmoral Handicap at Ascot on Champions Day but he wasn't quite ready in time. He could have a spin over hurdles before Newbury but that's our main objective. I'd love to sneak him into the bottom of the Betfair Hurdle or something like that one day. He probably needs to improve 10lb or 12lb for that but he'll win races this season. 18-10-23

runners.comment: Won his last two races last term; disappointing both starts this time; headgear now tried
runners.name: Bucephalus

quotes.race: Grosvenor Sport New Customers Double Odds Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bucephalus is a pleasure to ride and you just let him do his thing. You can keep the revs up on him and he keeps responding. He was a bit brave at one of the hurdles on the way round but he's a great ride - Harriet Tucker, jockey.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bucephalus jumped very well and settled better today in front - he'd been keen the last few times and didn't get home. We rode him handier today and he had the tongue-tie on and, on his Flat form, he always had the potential to go and win a race like that. He's handled soft ground before - Neil Mulholland, trainer.

quotes.race: Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap
quotes.quote: Once Bucephalus got cover, he settled. He's a lovely big horse and he finished really well - Rose Dawes, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won his last two races last season (2m, soft; ridden by Harriet Tucker); has been disappointing on both starts this season and is now tried in cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: He made a mistake on his return at Chepstow and was a little bit sore after the race so he's had a couple of easy weeks. He jumps fences well and could switch to that after a run over hurdles. He's good over two miles. 12-11-25

He's a lovely type who we acquired out of Ed Walker's stable last season at the horses in training sale. We turned him out as soon as we got him and he didn't come back until earlier this year. After a nice pipe-opener at Nottingham in April we dropped him back to a mile at Pontefract last month and he won impressively by four and a quarter lengths, but he paid the price with a 9lb hike to a mark of 79. He enjoys plenty of cut in the ground and opportunities could be limited during the summer months, so we might try him on the all-weather this week and if he handles that it would give us more scope. Being a German-bred you might expect him to stay further, but he's happy over a mile. We'll have to see how he gets on with a 9lb rise, but we have to take our medicine. I still think he'll be competitive off that mark if we can find the right opportunity for him. 30-06-21

runners.comment: Three wins last term; fair reappearance run; excuses for poor effort latest; interesting
runners.name: Serious Challenge

quotes.race: BoyleSports Casino Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Serious Challenge is a lovely horse. The run earlier in the week brought him forward a lot. He's in the Futurity at the Curragh so that's probably where he'll go next - Una Manning, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won three times in novice/maiden company last season, from 2m-2m4f on going ranging from good to heavy; fair reappearance run and excuses for lesser effort last time; interesting.

runners.comment: Has won five chases and six over hurdles; probably best watched after long absence
runners.name: Geromino

quotes.race: SBK Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Geromino is a smashing old horse. He has plenty of aches and pains but he's a really genuine racehorse. He's a good ground horse and we might look at the boys' race at Aintree for him  -Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Geromino is going up the handicap and is carrying big weights for a little horse so we thought we'd give him a run over hurdles. I was down by the last with the owner Gary Fitzpatrick, who's a great supporter, and moaning they were taking all the hurdles out because he's such a good jumper. But a 10lb claim in a Flat race is a lot and Charlie judged it well. I'm thrilled for the old horse because he's as genuine as can be - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: SG Estates Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's very genuine. Geromino has plenty of problems, he has a wind problem, he's not the best put-together but he's genuine. I just said to Brian (Hughes) as we go along we might be better off going back hurdling because he's not the scopiest in the world. While this quickish ground stays around, with small fields, we'll try and win more chases - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Stacey Bradley's Birthday Bash Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Geromino was schooling over fences in Ireland before he even ran, so we knew fences were what he was geared towards. It was a nice performance, giving his two rivals weight - Brian Hughes, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Has won six times over hurdles and five races over fences but has been off for 592 days and probably best watched this time.

stable_tour.quote: What is not to like about this lovely horse, who won four races on the bounce this season before going down by a head to Tommy's Oscar at Carlisle in October. He has had a nice break over the winter and is back in and cantering now. I would expect him to enjoy the better ground of the spring and we will try to keep him to a similar campaign again. His mark of 138 over fences is high enough, but I would be disappointed if he couldn't be effective off it again. 09-02-23

runners.comment: Won juvenile hurdle in France in July 2024; didn't show much on stable debut; bit to prove
runners.name: Col Du Pre
runners.spotlight: Ex-French; won a juvenile hurdle at Clarefontaine in July 2024 (2m1f, very soft); out of touch when unseating rider three out in a 2m handicap at Newbury on British/stable debut (50-1); bit to prove.

runners.comment: Formerly a decent hurdler/chaser who was best at 2m4f; well treated but not in top form
runners.name: Stoners Choice

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's well documented that Stoner's Choice is not the best jumper over hurdles but Max has always schooled him over hurdles and we always hoped he would respect a fence. He made one novice mistake down the back but other than that he was foot perfect. Max said he was idling a little in front. He's done the job lovely today and Max has given him a beautiful ride. It's important he goes right-handed but we'll have a look as we're limited this time of year. He loves the ground, so it would be a shame to put him away - Fergal O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Pertemps Network "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stoner's Choice has improved each time he's run, he seems on an upward curve. It was a fair performance today with a double penalty, the second horse didn't have a penalty so we were giving him a stone. We'd probably want to stick right-handed for now, he has had a tendency to go right before. You're either looking at running him in a handicap or a graded novice hurdle. We'll see what that handicapper does, he was on 127 before today and he'll probably go up a few pounds. There is the Winter Novices' Hurdle at Sandown over 2m4f, that may come a bit soon but we'll see how he comes out of this - Max Kendrick, jockey.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was lovely, we're very pleased with Stoner's Choice. That was a tidy race, he had a penalty and he travelled like the best horse all the way. He's going the right way. He'll stay hurdling for now. We've schooled him at home over fences but that's only trying to iron out the times when he tends to gallop into one - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Tilney For Professionals Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Div II)
quotes.quote: Stoner's Choice is a nice horse we've thought a lot of. He took a bit of time to get the hang of it at Market Rasen and was a little green here, but we've always thought a bit of him and he's proving us right. It could be a smart race and my horse has a great attitude. I ran him back quicker than I wanted, but I was keen to get him out to grass. We'll go straight hurdling next season and he looks a nice prospect; he's a smart horse. He looked like he stayed so we'll probably start in a novice hurdle. I don't think he'd want extremes of ground. He's got a good head on him for a nice horse - Ben Case, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Formerly quite a useful hurdler/chaser who was ideally suited by 2m4f; not as good these days and although on a good mark, hasn't shown a great deal this season.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; won three in summer of 2024; not shown much at long odds for present yard
runners.name: Rauzan

quotes.race: Waterford FC Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rauzan was behind the bridle the whole way, just struggling to hold his position. The trip was too short. Hugh said once he pulled him out wide he just locked onto it and once he met the rising ground he just went away from them - Eoin Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Dunlop Homes Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rauzan was in good nick, but the only problem was the drop back in trip. Slower ground out there helped and he handles it no problem - Hugh Morgan, rider.

quotes.race: Dunmore East Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rauzan wasn't really suited by Winter ground. His jumping has come together and I think there is a bit of improvement in him. He could do a job on the Flat over a trip - Eoin Doyle, rider

runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; won a handicap and two novices over further in the summer of 2024; bought for £11,000 in October; well beaten at long odds on both starts for new yard.

runners.comment: Ex-French; winner over hurdles and placed over fences; best watched on stable debut
runners.name: Sun Lady Marine
runners.spotlight: Ex-French; won a minor conditions race in July 2024 (2m2f, soft); placed in two chases in May; hard to know what to expect back hurdling on debut for new yard.

12:50.race_name: Boyle Sports Now Open In Taunton Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: M S And C S Griffiths
runners.comment: In career-best form when last seen on the Flat in August (RPR 78); hurdle debut today
runners.name: Bellator Bullet
runners.spotlight: 2-11 on the Flat for Alice Haynes; arguably posted career-best performance when close second at Newmarket (1m6f, good to firm; RPR 78) on latest outing in August and it will be interesting to see what Dan Skelton can do with him over hurdles.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on hurdle debut but this month's Market Rasen fifth was quite promising
runners.name: Bouquet De Paris

prev_owners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen

runners.spotlight: Placed on only Flat start; soundly beaten on stable/hurdle debut in October but ran well for a long way before weakening into fifth at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) this month and can improve again if the first-time hood helps him to relax here.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner in Ireland but showed only minor promise on first two hurdling starts
runners.name: Enziya

quotes.race: Kilberry Handicap
quotes.quote: Enziya got caught out in Tramore the last day when they went a fair gallop, and they just took him out of his comfort zone early on. What I loved about him that day was the way he came home and they didn't go that hard today, so he was travelling all the way. I thought today's 1m6f would be no bother to him and Dylan said he would go two miles. I'm very lucky to have him and I'd say the plan now will be to go over hurdles, and I think he will make a very good three-year-old hurdler. I'd say that's where he'll go next, if he is not sold. He's a lazy horse, but he's honest and has ability - Ryan Cody, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Signed off in the Flat in Ireland with 1m6f win during the summer (RPR 71) but has shown only minor promise on first two hurdling starts, albeit one was at Listed level and the other was on soft ground.

runners.comment: Fair form when winning over 1m6f on AW in September; a possible on AW debut
runners.name: Golden Garden
runners.spotlight: 1-9 on the Flat for Jamie Osborne, the win gained at Wolverhampton (1m6f, AW; RPR 78) in September; has raced only once on turf but will be fine stamina-wise over hurdles and enters calculations.

runners.comment: Made the frame on both French hurdling starts and is now with a top British stable
runners.name: Innamorato
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three times on the Flat in France and made the frame on both hurdling starts there, more recently when close third of 12 in Clairfontaine conditions race (2m1f, very soft) in August; now with a top British stable; must be considered.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two Flat maidens for Stan Moore this autumn; overlooked on hurdle debut
runners.name: Lamlash
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two Flat maidens for Stan Moore this autumn and cannot be recommended on this stable/hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Placed in low-grade Flat handicap in summer but pulled up on recent stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Launceston
runners.owner: S Keable L Cullimore G Tuck
runners.spotlight: Placed in a low-grade Flat handicap for Sir Mark Prescott in June (1m2f, firm; RPR 56) but didn't make any further progress for that stable and was pulled up (albeit on heavy ground) on recent stable/hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Hurdle winner in France; well beaten in Listed race on British debut; this is easier
runners.name: Madame De Labrunie
runners.spotlight: Won claiming hurdle at Auteuil (2m1f, very soft) in September and didn't run badly in Grade 1 chase in Italy later that month; ultimately well beaten in Listed fillies' hurdle for new stable in November but significant positives can still be drawn from that run and this race is easier.

runners.comment: 0-6 on Flat but showed some fair form and has joined a respectable stable for jumps career
runners.name: My Kinda Ghaiy
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat for Hugo Palmer at up to 1m4f but showed some fair form and has joined a respected stable for his hurdling career; cheekpieces (worn for two of last three races) discarded; no surprise if he features.

runners.comment: Unplaced all nine Flat starts and makes no appeal on hurdling debut
runners.name: Ta Craic Ann
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all nine Flat starts, and looked badly out of sorts when last seen in the summer; makes no appeal on hurdling debut; blinkers removed after one use.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big horse. Josephine Gordon rode him in a bit of work, his first little sort of thing, and she absolutely loved him. She thinks he's going to be a really smart horse. Kessaar's a sound enough sire and gets his winners. 04-07-24

runners.comment: Inconsistent on the Flat in Ireland but fair on his day and stays well; hurdle debut
runners.name: Wertpol
runners.spotlight: 0-9 in the Flat in Ireland this year and very inconsistent but twice recorded RPRs in the 70s, latterly when runner-up over 1m6f in August; joined Harry Derham for 37,000gns in October; a possible.

13:20.race_name: Boyle Sports Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Improvement is probably necessary after 2m win here but he's a serious each-way contender
runners.name: Knock Off Soxs
runners.spotlight: Won a British point in April; runner-up over 2m here in November and went one better from the front over that same C&D (again on good) 19 days ago; rallied for that win and this trip will surely be within his compass; improvement is probably necessary but he's a serious each-way contender.

runners.comment: Sets the standard with Newcastle win, looks capable of better and sure to stay this trip
runners.name: Le Beau Madrik

quotes.race: BetMGM EBF 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was hard work and Le Beau Madrik was going down to his left. I think he needs some racing really. Going left is not ideal, we need to iron that out, I wouldn't say there's anything physical.  Something may come to light in the next day or two but I think he's just got a small preference. I was disappointed to get him beat in a couple of bumpers but they were good bumpers. He's definitely all right, although he's next year's horse a bit - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Second in good-ground bumpers at Plumpton and Cheltenham before his 8-13 win in a maiden hurdle at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft) one month ago, when he was green and had to be switched before getting up late on; sets the standard, looks capable of better and sure to stay this trip.

runners.comment: 4th in a bumper and 2nd in three points, but tailed off at 100-1 in maiden at Exeter (2m)
runners.name: Blazing Litten
runners.spotlight: Fourth in a bumper and second in three points, but tailed off at 100-1 in a heavy-ground maiden at Exeter (2m) 12 days ago for hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Some ability at Hereford (2m4f) but adrift of the first two when falling at final flight
runners.name: Bushstreet Bowman
runners.owner: Ben Pauling Racing & Dr Suzannah Turk
runners.spotlight: Hurdles debut at Hereford (2m4f, good) five weeks ago confirmed he has ability but he was well adrift of the first two when falling at the final flight; needs marked improvement.

runners.comment: Modest Flat maiden at up to 2m1f; Knock Off Soxs was just over 17l ahead on hurdle debut
runners.name: Bye Bye Salam
runners.owner: D Smith & Hudson Plumbing And Heating
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden at up to 2m1f; 33-1 when mid-division here (extended 2m, good) on hurdle debut but Knock Off Soxs was just over 17l ahead.

runners.comment: His third hurdle race; work to do over new trip with tongue-tie on; yard runs two
runners.name: Crystello
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish point and 15l fourth of seven at Lingfield (2m, good to soft; 12-1) in his second maiden hurdle (both hurdle starts were under Harry Reed); work to do over new trip with tongue-tie on; yard runs two.

runners.comment: 18-1, tailed-off sixth of seven in bumper at Plumpton (2m2f, soft) four weeks ago
runners.name: Gettingawaywithit
runners.spotlight: 18-1, tailed-off sixth of seven in bumper at Plumpton (2m2f, soft) four weeks ago, so looks a longer-term project; yard runs two.

runners.comment: Useful on Flat in 2023; 28-1, no show in a Wincanton novice (2m4f, soft) two weeks ago
runners.name: Hadrianus
runners.spotlight: 28-1, no show in novice hurdle at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) two weeks ago; however, that came after 844 days off and he had useful middle-distance Flat form for Charlie Johnston in spring 2023; market can guide again.

stable_tour.quote: We don't have many Galileos! He joined us last year from Charlie Johnston but we couldn't run him as he got a touch of a leg. He hasn't run for a while, but he's in and doing some hard work. He'll be ready to run at the end of the month, although he'll probably need that first start. He does everything nicely and he was rated 104 on the Flat at one point, so he could be seriously nice. We'll start over two miles and find our way. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Fifth of nine in a warm bumper at Chepstow (2m, good) in April; needs a second look
runners.name: Kiss Gold
runners.spotlight: 9-1 and couldn't get into it when about 17l fifth of nine on debut in bumper at Chepstow (2m, good) in April; however, that was a warm race and he needs a second look on this hurdle/seasonal debut.

runners.comment: Half-brother to very useful Ahorsewithnoname; still time to come good but maybe not today
runners.name: Lake Tiberias
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to very useful Flat/hurdle winner Ahorsewithnoname; third in a Chepstow bumper (good), which he's not lived up to in two maiden hurdles; still time to come good but others are preferred today; yard runs two.

runners.comment: Finished closer in a bumper than he did in either of his hurdle races, beaten 44l latest
runners.name: No Panic
runners.spotlight: Finished closer in a Hereford bumper than he did in either of his hurdle races, beaten 44l at Wincanton last time; probably one for later on.

runners.comment: Won a British point; second favourite when second of 11 in a bumper here (good to firm)
runners.name: Religous Cross
runners.spotlight: 3l winner of a 2m4f, good-ground British point in March; second favourite when second of 11 in a bumper here (good to firm) last month, so should be a promising recruit to hurdling; yard runs two.

stable_tour.quote: He won a point-to-point in England and is a nice horse. He's green but he's improving week by week and will progress with experience. We'll take him away and work him on grass, and if we're happy enough with him we'll run him in a bumper. He's showing me at the moment he could be good enough for that. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Fifth of 14 here (extended 2m, good) 19 days ago, just over 13l behind Knock Off Soxs
runners.name: Ribba Hill
runners.owner: Syd Hosie Racing Syndicate - Ribba Hill
runners.spotlight: Won once on Flat (1m4f; fair form) but left Grant Tuer for £7,000; 500-1 at Cheltenham on hurdling debut and his fifth of 14 here (extended 2m, good) 19 days ago was better, albeit just over 13l behind Knock Off Soxs.

runners.comment: Half-sister to smart Killala Quay; 2nd of three in Irish point before £5,000 sale in May
runners.name: Galactic Princess
runners.spotlight: 4,000euros 3yo; tenth foal; half-sister to bumper and smart 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Killala Quay; dam unraced half-sister to 5f winners, from family of high-class miler Bijou D'Inde; second of three in an Irish maiden point before £5,000 sale in May; others have more striking claims.

13:50.race_name: Haydn Harrisson Christmas Memorial Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Lightly-raced maiden; encouraging third on chasing debut at Plumpton last month.
runners.name: Ballyfinn
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced maiden, he made an encouraging start over fences when tiring following a mistake at the final fence on his first start in 540 days when last of three finishers at Plumpton (3m1f, good; 2-1) last month; should strip fitter and comes into the reckoning.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in a point-to-point and the winner, Bective Abbey, was bought by Nicky Henderson for £150,000 and the third ran well in a Punchestown bumper. He'll start out in a bumper but we've schooled him and he goes well. 12-10-23

runners.comment: Showed little in three runs over hurdles last season; steps up in trip on chasing debut.
runners.name: Dyno Dave
runners.spotlight: Showed little in three runs over hurdles last season; steps up in trip on handicap/chasing debut for top stable and may now well come into his own.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fine, big individual and we've got him handicapped. He looks ready for three-mile novice chases and, off a mark of 105, there should be plenty of options for him this season. Hopefully we can give the fantastic team who own him plenty of fun along the way. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Won four over hurdles but things have not gone his way in two runs over fences.
runners.name: Jongleur Detoiles
runners.spotlight: Won four over hurdles but beaten 51l on chase debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) last month; unseated at Huntingdon (2m7f, soft) 23 days ago but drying ground will help here and not out of this.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit of a playboy - he'd be rearing up in the winner's enclosure. But he improved and won four hurdles, going up 29lb in the handicap. He jumps fences well when we've schooled him and he'll make a chaser. The track was a little bit tight for him on his first start at Fontwell, but we were looking for nice ground and he'll build on that - we were happy with how he jumped. He stays well. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Let down by her jumping when fifth on chase debut at Windsor last month.
runners.name: Hello Cello
runners.owner: Harry Fry Racing Syndicate Hello Cello
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning over hurdles on her reappearance at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) in October; made an inauspicious start to chasing when let down by her jumping when fifth of six finishers at Windsor (2m4f, good to soft) last month; steps up in trip and needs to get her jumping together.

runners.comment: Has been runner-up on his last two starts, both over C&D and holds place claims at least.
runners.name: Bertie Wooster
runners.spotlight: Sole success came over hurdles here in April 2024; is finding it difficult to get his head in front over fences but has been runner-up on his last two starts, both over C&D and holds place claims at least.

stable_tour.quote: He was third at Wincanton on his first start of the season but I thought he'd run better than that. West End Boy won the race for us and I didn't think there was much between the two. The trip was probably a bit sharp as he kept galloping and he possibly needed the run a bit. He'll go up in distance next time and should be winning off his mark. 10-11-23

runners.comment: Fifth at Exeter last month but refused to race at Hereford 20 days ago.
runners.name: Move With The Beat
runners.spotlight: Landed three points in the spring; made a satisfactory return to rules when fifth at Exeter (3m, good to soft) last month but refused to race at Hereford 20 days ago; all of a sudden has questions to answer.

runners.comment: Won at Fakenham in Octobe and creditable fourth at Leicester 26 days ago.
runners.name: Reforme

prev_owners.owner: T Rees And Mrs J Green

runners.spotlight: Perhaps fortunate to get off the mark at the 14th attempt when his rival capsized at the last at Fakenham (3m, good to soft) in October; creditable fourth of six at Leicester (2m6f, good to firm) 26 days ago; sports first-time tongue-tie; consistent sort but vulnerable to improvers.

runners.comment: Only denied by a short head at Exeter last month on his handicap/chasing debut.
runners.name: Fat Faced Columbo
runners.spotlight: Well held in both runs over hurdles last term but showed much more on his handicap/chasing debut when only denied by a short head at Exeter (3m, good to soft) last month; looks sure to go close if he can reproduce that effort.

runners.comment: Won point in February 2023 but has not been competitive in seven starts over hurdles.
runners.name: Only Gossip
runners.spotlight: Won point in February 2023 but has not been competitive in seven starts over hurdles; makes chase debut and she needs to show improvement.

runners.comment: Respectable second of seven finishers on her return to fences here 19 days ago.
runners.name: Inchagoill Lady

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Pickard, John Middleton & Edd Yeo

quotes.race: Lucia Stevens Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We had hit the crossbar with Inchagoill Lady a few times so we're delighted to see her win. The wind op has done her the world of good and she handled the quicker ground well. Lewis [Saunders] gave her a great ride and he has impressed us when we have used him. His 7lb claim definitely helps with the handicappers - Kevin Pickard, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when scoring over hurdles here (3m, good to firm) in April; respectable second of seven finishers on her return to fences here (2m2f, good) 19 days ago; should be suited by the return to further but others may be more unexposed.

14:20.race_name: Byerley Stud Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Quite impressive when winning twice on heavy ground in France this autumn
runners.name: Al Fonce
runners.spotlight: Joined current stable after a very promising debut in September and has comfortably won two heavy-ground conditions hurdles at Lyon Parilly (2m1f/2m3f) since; contender if handling the much quicker conditions here.

runners.comment: Settled much better in first-time hood and beat subsequent winner at Wetherby last month
runners.name: Anariza
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when upped to Listed grade at Cheltenham in April (raced too freely) but settled much better in a first-time hood and beat a next-time-out winner on last month's reappearance outing at Wetherby (2m, soft); open to further progress and enters calculations.

runners.comment: Promising in bumpers; was running a big race before falling three out at Ascot last month
runners.name: Getawhisky
runners.spotlight: Looked promising in bumpers last season (made the frame in a Listed race); just a respectable fourth on hurdle debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October but, under a much more positive ride, had the short-odds favourite out of his comfort zone before falling three out at Ascot (1m7f, good) last month; no surprise if she features.

stable_tour.quote: She won a bumper last year but was a little keen on her hurdling debut at Worcester last month. She'll be seen to much better effect off a faster pace, and she has plenty of speed for two miles. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Won small-field bumper on debut but safely held in a Listed bumper next time
runners.name: Great Dance
runners.spotlight: Second foal from Willie Mullins' smart hurdler Let's Dance; comfortably won four-runner Newton Abbot bumper (good to soft) on debut in October but managed only ninth in soft-ground Listed bumper at Huntingdon last month and needs to take a big step forward on this hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Respectable fifth at Newbury last month but has over 7l to find with St Irene here
runners.name: Heron In The Park
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner last season; bettered disappointing hurdle debut (raced too freely) when respectable fifth at Newbury (2m, good to soft; first-time hood) last month but was over 7l behind St Irene there and needs to make further progress; quickly back in action after mid-race mishap at Kempton on Boxing Day.

runners.comment: 2-2 over hurdles this autumn (both wins on good ground); set to play another big role here
runners.name: Lady Tadita

quotes.race: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She attacked her hurdles a lot more today. Lady Tadita seems to be going the right way. She felt sharper, more tuned in and hopefully she'll step forward again -  Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

quotes.race: S&D Bookmakers Ltd - Visit One Of Our 9 Branches Fillies' "Junior" NH Flat Race (Cat 1 Elim') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Lady Tadita had hardly been off the bridle at home or on the grass but we did take her to Windsor the other day for a spin. We could look at the Listed bumper at Cheltenham on New Years Day - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a bumper on only start last season and launched hurdling career with good-ground wins at Market Rasen and Huntingdon (both 2m) this autumn; well worth her place in this line-up and looks set to play a major role.

stable_tour.quote: She's very smart and is two from two now, winning a bumper and a novice hurdle. She probably won't take a lot of racing as she's quite a light-framed individual, so we'll target Listed races and Grade 2s with her. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Placed in four Irish maiden hurdles in the summer; upped in grade for stable debut
runners.name: October Hill
runners.spotlight: Placed in four consecutive Irish maiden hurdles for Colin Bowe this summer (2m-2m4f, good-yielding) before changing hands for £20,000 in September; upped in grade for stable debut and needs to improve.

runners.comment: Sold £80,000 after winning Irish point debut in October; set tough task on rules debut
runners.name: Our Peggy
runners.spotlight: Made all to win by 10l on Irish point debut in October (yielding to soft), after which she changed hands for £80,000; set tough assignment on rules debut but good market support will bring her into the equation.

runners.comment: Useful in bumpers last season and has made a bright start to hurdling career this term
runners.name: St Irene

quotes.race: pricedup.bet Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Herring Queen Mares' Novices' Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jack [Quinlan, jockey] was really happy with St Irene. She just pricked her ears down the home straight and looked like she enjoyed herself. She jumped brilliantly and it's been a super day all round. There's no fixed plan, but we'll have an eye on one of the finals in the spring - Nick Schofield, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Useful in bumpers for Ben Brookhouse last season and has made bright start to hurdling career for new stable this term, belying 40-1 odds when runner-up at Newbury (2m, good to soft) before easily making all at Wincanton (1m7f, good); ought to make her presence felt again.

runners.breeder: M Larobe, P Thiriet & R Gourmau
runners.comment: Runner-up in Warwick juvenile hurdle on British debut; has a bit more on her plate here
runners.name: Miss Carbo
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two juvenile hurdles in France in the spring and again on British debut at Warwick (2m, good to soft) this month; has a bit more on her plate against older rivals here; hood/cheekpieces added.

14:50.race_name: Boyle Sports Home Of Early Payout Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: One of his best efforts latest; first run much beyond 2m5f under rules and it's worth a go
runners.name: Bitsnbuckles
runners.spotlight: 1-10 over hurdles and opposable on most form; his highest two RPRs were at Huntingdon, including when third this month (tongue tied first time) on his second run after a year off; this is his first run much beyond 2m5f under rules and it's worth a go.

runners.comment: Clearcut winner over about 2m6f at Fontwell (good to soft/heavy) in his two handicaps
runners.name: Mask Of Zorro
runners.spotlight: Well held in his qualifying runs but clearcut winner over about 2m6f at Fontwell (good to soft/heavy) in his two handicaps; up 6lb for this hat-trick bid but likely to stay and find further improvement.

runners.comment: Nothing to cheer in his last three starts, hooded latest and leaving Alison Thorpe since
runners.name: I Am Spider Man
runners.spotlight: 3-23 over hurdles, his latest wins a double at Sligo in summer 2024; with nothing to cheer in his last three starts, hooded latest and leaving Alison Thorpe since, he's best watched for now.

runners.comment: Way out of form until a partial recovery when returned to hurdles on latest start
runners.name: Face Dmusic

quotes.race: Alpha Aggregates Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Face D'Music was very good today and we're very happy. He'd been schooling very well at home and jumped brilliantly today. It was a much-needed confidence booster for Shane [Quinlan, jockey]. It's horses for courses as he won over hurdles at Hereford in May too, even though he looks like he wants a more galloping track. He's only five and a few things went wrong earlier this season, but they're going right now - Katy Price, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 3m1f hurdle and chase winner, most recently in November 2024 off 4lb higher; way out of form since until a partial recovery when returned to hurdles on latest start, which he needs to build on.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in his three handicaps, last two after a year off; headgear goes on
runners.name: Milan Ac
runners.owner: Got There In The End Partnership
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo, best when runner-up in a maiden hurdle at Ffos Las (2m4f, good) in May 2024; soundly beaten since in his three handicaps, back over hurdles latest on second run since a year off; headgear goes on.

runners.comment: Ran respectably latest on first go at this sort of trip; blinkers replace other headgear
runners.name: See The Green
runners.spotlight: 1-9 as a hurdler, sole win on first attempt; third on his last three outings, running respectably at Exeter last time on his first attempt at this sort of trip; needs better than that and, having tried cheekpieces and a visor, he is now switched to blinkers.

runners.comment: No improvement for going handicapping on last two starts (2m4f/1m7f); now jumps up to 3m
runners.name: Its A Breeze

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Helen Moger & Mrs Diana L Whateley

runners.spotlight: Represents a top stable but no improvement when remote third in farcical race on seasonal/handicap debut at Plumpton (2m4f, good) last month and tailed off at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) two weeks ago; now jumps up to 3m.

stable_tour.quote: Don't take too much notice of last season's unpromising form figures; he's been a backward individual who has just needed time to mature. There are signs he's getting there, so as he's at the right end of the handicap don't be surprised if he is able to run up a little sequence. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Won at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft) last time; back up 4lb but one to consider
runners.name: Lelantos
runners.spotlight: Missed 2024 and has not been in top form since but he still won at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft) last time; back up 4lb but one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running in staying handicap hurdles through the summer and was second this month at Hexham after a short break. He'll continue down that route. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Cheekpieces at Exeter last two starts when second over 2m5f but disappointing over 2m2f
runners.name: Chedingtons Guest
runners.owner: Sara Marchant Chris Pugsley, Shaun Hearn
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; cheekpieces were added at Exeter for last two starts when second to Square Du Roule over 2m5f (good to soft) but disappointing favourite over 2m2f; needs to see it out better than he did over 3m2f at Huntingdon three starts back, his only run at a staying trip.

runners.comment: Exposed at about 2m (tried 2m3f once in 2024) and there's now a huge rethink on the trip
runners.name: Lady Caro
runners.spotlight: Looks thoroughly exposed at about 2m (some minor honours this autumn) and, having tried 2m3f once in 2024, there's now a huge rethink on the trip.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think she wants the ground as soft as it was at Warwick on Tuesday and just weakened when you didn't want her to. She shaped like a horse with lots of ability and will come on a bundle for it. 02-11-22

runners.comment: He's not shown much in his three novice hurdles (up to 2m4f) and now he goes handicapping
runners.name: The Italian Fox
runners.spotlight: He's not shown much in his three novice hurdles (up to 2m4f); better is always possible now that he goes handicapping but his stable also runs hat-trick seeker Mask Of Zorro.

runners.comment: Sole win penultimate start; running-on C&D fourth last time suggests he's a major player
runners.name: Square Du Roule
runners.spotlight: Harry Cobden on for last two outings, first with a kid-gloves ride to get up late on at Exeter (extended 2m5f, good to soft); that's his only win from 17 races but running on well for fourth of 16 from well off the pace over C&D (good) last time was comparable form and suggests he's a major player.

15:23.race_name: Boyle Sports Daily Money Back Meetings Handicap Chase

runners.breeder: Miss Sally Harler & Mr Matthew Darling
runners.comment: Absent 374 days before this term; second over hurdles last time and he's well handicapped
runners.name: Gingerbred
runners.spotlight: Stayer who was consistent over fences in 2024; absent 374 days before this season but second of seven over hurdles at Exeter (2m7f) last time showed that plenty of ability remains; well handicapped on 2024 form.

stable_tour.quote: Maybe he's one who is improving. He's off a pretty low mark at the moment but he ran very well at Cheltenham on his final run last season (third in the 3m4f handicap chase) and at Chepstow on his return when keeping on well. 30-10-24

runners.comment: 3-4 in October-December 2024 (chasing); second (hurdles) recently after almost a year off
runners.name: West Orchard

quotes.race: Nationwide Concreting Supporting The Rockbourne Partnership Handicap Chase (Font' Chs Series Qual')
quotes.quote: West Orchard had some little issues last season but seems completely different now. He won really nicely. He got headed turning in but battled well and won quite easily - Freddie Gingell, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won three out of four in October-December 2024 (chasing) and took second at Wincanton (hurdles) early this month when returning from almost a year off; could build on that to register a prominent finish.

stable_tour.quote: Last season was a brilliant one with three wins, but he got a little leg injury in the winter. He's back in and everything's good with him, so he'll be ready for his first run in a few weeks' time and hopefully he can build on his last campaign. 12-11-25
