runners.comment: Very mixed record but won here and in the process of running well when he fell last time
runners.name: Anytrixwilldo
runners.spotlight: Won four-runner contest in first-time cheekpieces (kept since) over 3m4f here on good to firm in April; has very mixed record over fences but was in the process of running well when he fell two out at Wincanton last time; would figure prominently if in the same form.

runners.comment: Three wins under Lucy Turner this year and creditable minor honours on last two outings
runners.name: Faitque De Lisle
runners.spotlight: Ridden these days by Lucy Turner, including when he won twice over 3m at Ludlow (good to soft/soft) in February and readily at Uttoxeter (3m, good) in October; creditable minor honours on last two outings and the same may be possible in this race.

stable_tour.quote: He came to us after racing in France as well as a spell with Ed de Giles in England and had shown glimpses of form but not got his head in front. We gave him one run last season before putting him away and bringing him back at Stratford, where he ran a nice race to be third over 2m3½f. Stepping him up to 3m clearly had the desired effect as he won next time out at Ffos Las. It was a big step forward from him and clearly staying chasing is his game. He jumped very well at the Welsh track and got every inch of the 3m. We could head up to Newcastle on Thursday with him as there a couple of options there for him. He is up to a mark of 100 now and I would like to think from what he has done so far that there is more in the tank. 21-11-22

runners.comment: Blinkered on last two starts, running creditably on first occasion but not on latest
runners.name: Edgewell

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.spotlight: Chase winner in Ireland in 2024 and dual hurdles winner in Britain this February; battled on from a poor position when creditable fourth at Windsor (3m, good to soft) in November with first-time blinkers, which have been kept since; he was not similarly motivated at Wincanton two weeks ago, however.

stable_tour.quote: He'd been a very disappointing horse but has shown plenty of ability at home and maybe the quirky nature of Downpatrick brought the best out of him when he won there last week, albeit it wasn't the strongest race. We hope he can translate that form back to Britain. 16-10-24

runners.comment: 22-race maiden before he ended a run of seconds by winning a four-runner race last time
runners.name: Jukebox Deddy

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mrs D E Lewis

runners.spotlight: 22-race maiden before he ended a run of seconds by winning from the front in a four-runner race at Market Rasen (3m, good to soft) on latest start, wearing a first-time visor; back up just 2lb but the longer-term record has to prompt a bit of caution regarding win prospects.

runners.breeder: Neil & Jane Maltby & Mr & Mrs R Bandey
runners.comment: Maiden; soundly beaten this season and he's now 8lb out of the handicap
runners.name: Hellstopatthetop
runners.spotlight: 0-4 in points and 0-13 under rules; soundly beaten this season, first trying cheekpieces last time, and he's now 8lb out of the handicap.

15:55.race_name: Musgrove Park Hospital League Of Friends Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Handicap Hurdle (RE)

runners.comment: Disappointed last month but ran well on seasonal/handicap debut at Cheltenham; new trip
runners.name: Zaochen Enki

quotes.race: Andy Mcdonald's 70th Birthday "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zaochen Enki came over from France just before Christmas very light and lean and we didn't think we'd get a run into him this season as it also took a while to get him to settle down and relax. This his will have done him an awful lot of good and he'll remain a novice until December 1st - Paul Nicholls, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who was very respectable sixth of 12 on seasonal/handicap debut at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft) in October; disappointed at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) last month but moves up in trip here and probably still has potential.

stable_tour.quote: He took a long time to acclimatise after coming from France last autumn. A Wincanton novice hurdle success, wearing a hood, did his confidence good but what he really needed was a good summer break. He's still inclined to be a bit keen in his work but hopefully he'll settle better as he gets older. He needs further experience as a lack of it showed when he reappeared off a low weight under Freddie Keighley in the conditional jockeys' handicap at Cheltenham. He got a bit tired up the straight but will come on plenty for the run, especially as it was only the fourth run of his life. That was over two miles, but as he's related to winners up to three miles he should benefit from a step up in trip fairly soon. He should go close next time. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Returned to form with creditable second to progressive rival at Kempton last month
runners.name: Cornish Storm
runners.spotlight: Just 1-10 over hurdles but the win was gained here (2m, good to soft) and he returned to form with creditable second to progressive rival at Kempton (2m, good) last month; subsequent defeat is best overlooked (lost all chance when stumbling and almost falling); contender if combination of new trip and first-time cheekpieces works for him.

runners.comment: Not beaten far this month, after a break, but his overall profile is not that appealing
runners.name: Balboa

quotes.race: Champion Hats Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's taken a while for the penny to drop. Balboa has had two runs but he still had a look at the first (hurdle). We got a bit of good fortune with the non-runners but that's racing and you've got to kick the ball when it's in front of you. He's ok and he's solid, he seems to handle the soft ground. We might turn up at the Cheltenham meeting in November, although we do have some higher rated who could go there. Milton Harris, trainer

runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when seventh at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) this month, after a break, and has become well handicapped but others appeal more than this regressive and inconsistent 5yo.

runners.comment: Below form this month but was second in two big-field handicaps this autumn
runners.name: Dirty Den
runners.spotlight: Below form on latest outing (behind Balboa; usual hood missing) but came second in big-field handicaps (2m3f/2m, good) on first two starts after rejoining Syd Hosie this autumn and has strong claims here if judged on those efforts; hood back on.

runners.comment: Safely held when third in a recent maiden; cheekpieces added for handicap return
runners.name: Green Sky

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Green Sky progressed well after a good debut and will likely step into a handicap or winners race now - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who was safely held when third in Hereford maiden (2m, good to soft; first run after wind op) this month and is now 0-11 over hurdles; sports new cheekpieces for this handicap return; needs to up her game.

runners.comment: Multiple hurdle/chase winner in France; well beaten this month, after one-year absence
runners.name: Vernon Subutex

prev_owners.owner: Scuderia Christian Troger & Marco Luigi Biffi

runners.spotlight: Multiple hurdle/chase winner (mostly in France); well beaten at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) this month, after one-year absence; might have needed that outing and drops in grade here but remains tricky to weigh up.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Plumpton this month but back up in grade here and not the force of old
runners.name: Inferno Sacree
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who gained all five wins in the first half of 2023; ran well when second at Plumpton (2m, soft) this month and will also be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination but moves back up in grade here and is not the force of old; others preferred.

runners.comment: Unexposed mare who was hampered when fourth on recent handicap debut; can do better
runners.name: Border Gem
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far on any of her four hurdling starts and was unlucky to be hampered by penultimate-flight faller when fourth on recent handicap debut at Wincanton (2m4f, soft); will be suited by the return to forecast good ground here and still has a bigger run in her.

16:30.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: Out of sorts on AW in the spring and no improvement back on turf at York in October.
runners.name: Circuit Breaker

quotes.race: Try Unibet's Improved Bet Builder Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Circuit Breaker had a really tough trip at Hamilton last time and it was all too much for him. I had to leave him alone after that and, with the size of his feet, he wants a bit of juice in the ground. He might be one for the final of this series and I'm glad I've got him back on track - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Out of sorts on AW in the spring and no improvement back on turf at York in October; is down to a career-low mark but this may not be a sufficient test of stamina.

stable_tour.quote: It was a funny race with just four runners that he won at Kempton, but we always expected him to come on for that run. He's an out-and-out stayer and maybe something like the River Don in the spring might be an option. He cost plenty from the Flat but jumped well at Kempton and should continue to improve. 06-11-24

runners.comment: His tendency to start slowly was his downfall when fifth of nine at Lingfield 22 days ago.
runners.name: Gifted Angel

quotes.race: Trustatrader Apply Today Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think jumping takes Gifted Angel's mind off the effort he's having to put in. Gavin said he had it won all the way until he hit the front and thought, 'that's it'. The reason he's won today is he jumps so bloody well. I've always said this horse has loads of ability, but he's never really shown it on the Flat - Tom Dascombe, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Returned from a 12-month absence with two good runner-up finishes but his tendency to start slowly was his downfall when fifth of nine at Lingfield (1m4f) 22 days ago; step back up in trip should be in his favour.

runners.comment: Won here in October and good third over C&D subsequently; flying too high last time.
runners.name: Francesco Baracca
runners.spotlight: Appreciated the drop in class and return to AW when successful here (2m) in October off 3lb lower mark and wasn't beaten far when third over C&D last month; not so good in a much better race at Kempton (2m) 27 days ago but should take plenty of beating back in this grade.

stable_tour.quote: He's bonny and wins in his turn. He won two starts ago at Bath over 1m6f but was disappointing when last of four at Lingfield on Saturday. That was over 1m3½f and he needs further, but he does tend to win one and then run disappointingly the next time. That's just him. 02-07-25

runners.comment: Five-time course winner but all of his wins have been at shorter trips.
runners.name: Civil Law

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Handicap
quotes.quote: Civil Law is in the Queen Mother Cup at York tomorrow and we'll see how he is. He's not blowing there and it's a 15,000GBP race. He could have done with a better gallop. Ben said they probably didn't go quick enough for him - Brian Ellison, trainer

runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner but all of his wins have been at shorter trips and latest was over two years ago; has dropped to a career-low mark and step up in trip may not suit; opposable.

runners.comment: Faded to finish fourth over C&D 22 days ago but may warrant another chance.
runners.name: Moon Sniper
runners.owner: C L A Edginton & A J Niven
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Newcastle (1m4f, AW) in October and ran his best race when cruelly denied by two late finishers when third here (1m4f) last month; step up to 1m6f did not go as expected when fading to finish fourth over C&D 22 days ago but may warrant another chance.

runners.comment: Won here in June but at his best at Southwell where he has rattled off six wins.
runners.name: Young Endless
runners.spotlight: Won here in June but at his best at Southwell where he has rattled off six wins; fair fourth at Newcastle (2m, AW) two weeks ago but the handicapper may have his measure for now.

runners.comment: 0-6 but ran her best race for top connections when second of ten here 29 days ago.
runners.name: Gold Penny
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but ran her best race for top connections when second of ten here (1m4f) 29 days ago when sporting first-time cheekpieces (retained); looks a shade one paced but this step up in trip could bring about further improvement.

runners.comment: Third of ten at Newcastle following a short break on just his second run on Tapeta.
runners.name: Cosmic Soul
runners.owner: M Lee, D Lee, C Jolley & P Neville

prev_owners.owner: M Lee, D Lee & P Neville

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap (For The Turmeric Challenge Trophy)
quotes.quote: Cosmic Soul deserved a win, he was just unlucky a few times. He's just taken a long time to come to hand, when we got him we thought he was ready to go but he's just taken patience and time. He's matured in his head so hopefully he'll kick on from here - Patrick Neville, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning at Catterick (2m, good to firm) in July when sporting first-time visor (discarded here); encouraging third of ten at Newcastle (2m) following a short break on just his second run on Tapeta and cannot be discounted.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go back hurdling providing the ground doesn't get too heavy. We've been scratching our heads because he hasn't replicated his good homework on the track. We've sorted a few little issues and he's in great nick. 11-12-24

17:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap

runners.comment: Not at best last time but this is a drop in class and he's a contender on his best form
runners.name: My Dad Tom
runners.spotlight: Latest Lingfield run wasn't his best but he has run some good races in better company; drops into his first Class 6 and could bounce back.

runners.comment: Placed in 3 of her 4 starts; steps back up to 6f for her nursery debut; not fully exposed
runners.name: Havana Jag
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, D Cunha, M Broughton

prev_owners.owner: Matt Broughton & Hold My Beer Syndicate

runners.spotlight: Placed in three of her four starts, including here on her last two starts (5f); steps back up to 6f for her nursery debut; not fully exposed.

runners.comment: Bath win (5.7f) in September; below par on heavy next time; capable of better
runners.name: Reality Queen
runners.spotlight: Improved to win a Bath nursery in September (5.7f, good to firm); unable to back it up three weeks later but the going was heavy there; could bounce back on her return from ten weeks off.

runners.comment: Dropping down the weights but needs to raise his game a level if he is to break his duck
runners.name: Must Be Ten
runners.spotlight: Not seen to best effect in AW nurseries on last two starts; continues to edge down the weights but others look open to greater progress.

runners.comment: No real progress over 5f, including nursery debut latest; new trip not enough to tempt
runners.name: Baileys Ontherocks
runners.spotlight: Weak in the market and failed to improve for a switch to nurseries at Chelmsford this month (5f); steps up to 6f with a point to prove.

runners.comment: Unsuited by the drop to 5f last time; earlier Lingfield 2nd was a promising run; e-w shout
runners.name: Blindfold Games
runners.spotlight: Two promising efforts in nurseries, second over 6f at Lingfield before finding 5f inadequate at Chelmsford 12 days ago; wasn't beaten far there though and she's one to consider back up in trip.

runners.comment: Three good nursery runs, beaten a short head at Newcastle latest; now blinkered; wide draw
runners.name: Sunlit Sea
runners.spotlight: Three good runs in nurseries, beaten a short-head at Newcastle two weeks ago (5f); drawn widest and the addition of blinkers will need to spark a bit of improvement.

runners.comment: Good effort over 5f here last week but this is a deeper race and opposable back at 6f
runners.name: Mister Moet
runners.spotlight: Exposed after ten starts but he ran well for second over 5f here last week; not sure to appreciate returning to 6f; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Modest form in 3 starts, the latest his AW debut; improvement essential now handicapping
runners.name: Spirit Of Mara
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three starts, the latest his AW debut three weeks ago (5f); improvement essential now handicapping.

runners.comment: Modest form for Alice Haynes; sold 1,000gns in October; drops in trip on stable debut
runners.name: Resalah

prev_owners.owner: Ahmad H Al Mutairi & Hicky Parmar Racing

runners.spotlight: Modest form for Alice Haynes; sold for 1,000gns in October; drops back in trip for her stable debut but others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Well beaten over 7f last time but earlier 6f nursery form brings him into the reckoning
runners.name: Far Too Fizzy
runners.spotlight: Made a winning nursery debut at Chelmsford in October (6f); not beaten far on his next two runs but latest 7f run was disappointing; still feasibly weighted back at this trip.

17:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.breeder: Mrs M Leurson & Mrs C Head
runners.comment: Won this race last year off 3lb higher; poor run at Ayr last time; better expected today
runners.name: Coachello

quotes.race: Dubai Sprint Presented by Longines (Listed Race) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Coachello broke well and travelled strongly before really battling close home on ground he enjoyed - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 3lb higher mark; two runs in September saw him unseat his rider early at Ascot and then deliver a lacklustre performance in the Ayr Silver Cup; no surprise to see him bounce back under these conditions.

runners.comment: Only seen twice in 2025 and well beaten on both occasions; others have less to prove
runners.name: Media Shooter

quotes.race: Champagne Pommery Brut Royal Gold Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up to seven furlongs has helped Media Shooter a bit. You need that six-furlong speed going this trip around here as you need the early pace to get into a position. He was able to do that and they went a good gallop. I was able to follow the favourite and he's won going away. The cheekpieces helped and the decent ground too. He ran in a very competitive race at York [three starts before] and finished fourth, so the form was there anyway - Sam James, jockey, speaking to  Racing TV

runners.spotlight: C&D winner; well beaten in two runs in 2025, the latest his stable debut 13 days ago; others have less to prove.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Well backed when beating Valley Ofthe Kings at Lingfield last time; well drawn; contender
runners.name: Intervention

quotes.race: William Hill/MND Association Great St Wilfrid Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a massive pot for a horse like Intervention. It's a big handicap for whatever horse it is, but at his age, he's just been an absolute star for us. We kind of felt he could run well, looking at the quality of the race this year. Outside the top three, it was a 0-90. With question marks against each of those three classier horses, we did feel that we had a decent chance and that the track would suit him - and it did. He wasn't much higher for Wolverhampton and he'd got good form on the all-weather off slightly higher marks. Martin [Dixon, brother and part-owner] got William [Pyle] booked very early on and his three pounds off was always going to help. We thought we were going to need a lightweight rider, so we thought we may as well take a little bit of weight off on top of that. William does seem one of those riders where some of these sprinters will just run for him - Chris Dixon, part-owner.

quotes.race: Win £2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

runners.spotlight: Four wins this year, including C&D, and he was well supported when beating Valley Ofthe Kings at Lingfield two weeks ago (6f); up 4lb but well drawn and should make another bold bid.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over £100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.comment: 11-time winner but well short of his best over C&D when last seen 142 days ago
runners.name: Many A Star

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Many A Star did it well. With a horse of his age, especially at this sort of distance, when they're in good form it's best to keep rolling. He's a big horse and is taking his racing well. This track does really suit him as it gives him a long time to wind up. They went a strong gallop and he picked up a bit quicker than I thought he would, we were in front plenty long enough, but he's very game and it's a credit to Jamie [Osborne, trainer] and the team for keeping him in such good form - William Carver, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: The ground is challenging and did not really suit Many A Star but he ran really well. He struggled a bit to get out as they all came in very tight and when he got out he did not pick up as we'd have liked but on this ground the softer-ground horses did better - Jeffrey Hobby, owner.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation race for The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: The last time Many A Star ran at Newmarket six weeks ago there was no pace and he didn't run any race. We just thought after that race that he'd run a few times and decided to give him a break and it's all come to fruition. He gained weight during the break and he's looking better now. We might look at the Ayr Gold Cup - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Events At Ascot Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Many A Star is quite a nice horse. He has a bit of confidence now and I think he has come on from his last run at Goodwood. He stripped a bit fitter today and will probably go for a bigger handicap, but he loved that ground - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Seadeer Handicap
quotes.quote: Many A Star is a shell of a horse and will be nice next year. He enjoyed the ground - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.spotlight: The winner of 11 of his 65 starts; well short of his best when second of four in a claimer over C&D in August; may come on for this first start since and others appeal more.

stable_tour.quote: He'll win again soon. Although he's won on soft ground, I think he's much better on a quicker surface. He'll either go back to the all-weather or we'll find quick ground for him. He's well capable with conditions in his favour. He'll probably drop in the handicap and will be tough to beat. 11-09-24

runners.comment: Little to celebrate this year but down in weights and gelded since last seen; not solid
runners.name: Kullazain

quotes.race: Madri Excepcional EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We liked Kullazain at the sales but he was a bit of a baby. He had sore shins and he was a bit behind so we've given him time, but we learnt a bit at Ripon and he was impressive here. He'll be better next year. He likes soft ground so I suppose we could think about something like the Cornwallis or a Listed race at Chantilly at the end of October - James Tate, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Group 3-placed as a 2yo; little to cheer this year but he has dropped down the weights and has been gelded since last seen six weeks ago; no headgear today.

stable_tour.quote: I went into this season thinking he was a really good horse and he certainly looked one based on his three runs last year, when he won and was third twice. He should be stronger and better this year. The ground was too quick for him at Haydock in the Group 2 Sandy Lane Stakes first time out - he probably didn't get the 6f anyway and on top of that he probably needed the run. He's ready to go again but the rain gods haven't been kind to him and we're going to have to wait a bit. I'm sure he's one to look out for in the autumn if it doesn't rain in the short term. 09-07-25

runners.comment: Two wins this autumn and career-best RPR when 2nd to Intervention latest; even more needed
runners.name: Valley Ofthe Kings
runners.spotlight: Two wins this autumn and back to form when chasing home Intervention at Lingfield 13 days ago; that was a career-best RPR but he will need another to come out on top here.

runners.comment: Made all to beat Papa Cocktail over C&D last week; more on his plate under a penalty
runners.name: Accrual

quotes.race: Sporting Family Change Promoting Kindness British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His first run, Accrual didn't really know what he was doing, but today he was much sharper at the gates - Pat Cosgrave, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Free-going sort who showed 6f was no problem with a front-running C&D win last week; 5lb penalty demands more but he is unexposed at the distance.

runners.comment: 5f Chelmsford win before fine 3rd back there (6f) 12 days ago; strong claims off same mark
runners.name: Havana Rum
runners.spotlight: Coped well with the drop to 5f when scoring at Chelmsford early this month; fine effort in a valuable 6f event back at Chelmsford 12 days ago, dropped in from a wide stall and making good ground from 2f out before meeting trouble at a crucial stage; solid claims off the same mark.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and 5lb better off with Accrual on recent C&D run; each-way shout
runners.name: Papa Cocktail
runners.spotlight: Two wins this year, the latest an easy C&D win in October; held his form since, more recently chasing home Accural here last week; 5lb better off with that rival and holds each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: I think he is a very nice colt with a bright future. His work had been encouraging this spring and we started him off over 7f late last month at Yarmouth in what looked a particularly hot maiden, with several of the big yards represented and many trainers liking their charges. He ran a cracker to be third behind New Science, where he was rather green but ran on well. It was the perfect start to his career as he will have learned plenty and mentally handled things well. There are a few 7f maidens around Royal Ascot time later this month and we will pick our spot to make him a winner and take it from there. He runs in the colours of owner Khalifa Dasmal, who is a great man to train for. His patronage is largely thanks to my former guv'nor David Simcock giving him a nod in my direction. David has been a huge help to me in my career and I am very hopeful that I have a potentially nice horse here for Mr Dasmal. 10-06-21

18:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B-D) (GBB) (Div I)

runners.comment: Promising debut when 3rd of 12 at Lingfield this month; open to improvement
runners.name: All Worthwhile
runners.spotlight: Made an encouraging start to her career when third of 12 at Lingfield three weeks ago (7f); open to improvement and should give another good account.

runners.comment: Dam a 9.4f AW winner from a good family; may not come into her own until tackling 1m+
runners.name: Chantelle
runners.spotlight: Second foal of a 9.4f AW winner (RPR 74), herself a half-sister to two winners from the family of Coventry Stakes winner Three Valleys; may not come into her own until tackling 1m+.

runners.comment: Three solid 6f runs, 2nd twice here; sets standard and some encouragement for 7f on paper
runners.name: Queen Sana
runners.spotlight: Three sound efforts over 6f, runner-up at this track on the last two occasions; some encouragement for 7f on breeding and she sets the standard.

runners.comment: Clear signs of ability in two 7f runs this winter; still capable of better
runners.name: Safe Harbor
runners.spotlight: Similar form in two 7f runs this winter, more recently when unable to justify market prominence at Southwell; should still have a bigger effort in her and she holds each-way claims.

runners.comment: 9,000gns half-sister to five winners; yard not known for 2yo winners
runners.name: Dora Vita
runners.spotlight: 9,000gns yearling; half-sister to winners Moulin Booj (5f including AW; RPR 92), Lesley's Boy (5.5f/6f 2yo; 87), Iva Go (5f 2yo; 73), Windy Guest (6f AW 2yo; 69) and Flirty Rascal (Qatari 6f/7.5f); dam 7f winner (79); bred to have a future but stable not known for 2yo exploits.

runners.comment: Did lots wrong on C&D debut but showed plenty of promise all the same; likely big improver
runners.name: Fair Y Isle
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and ended up beaten nearly 7l on her debut over C&D last month but that barely tells the story as she blew the start, had a lot of use made of her to get a prominent position (out wide) and she was still bang there turning for home, only to run green and tire in the straight; that form has been boosted and she is open to considerable improvement.

runners.comment: Awkward at the start and never threatened when last of 14 on Lingfield debut (7f)
runners.name: Sands End
runners.spotlight: Attracted some support on her Lingfield debut six weeks ago but she was always behind after an awkward start; hard to recommend.

runners.comment: Headed in the final stride on her debut here 24 days ago; third has won since; big player
runners.name: Seeing Stars
runners.spotlight: Headed in the final stride by another newcomer in a C&D fillies' novice 24 days ago; that form has been boosted by the third and she is a strong contender with progress likely.

18:30.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B-D) (GBB) (Div II)

runners.comment: Promise in two sprint runs in the summer; bred to stay 7f; more to come; respected
runners.name: Jamie Sommers
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in two sprint novice races for fillies in the summer; bred to stay this longer trip and she is open to improvement; one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Second foal of a minor 1m4f winner; betting should be revealing on debut
runners.name: Katies Song
runners.spotlight: Second foal of a minor 1m4f winner; starts out in a modest event and she is one to note for market confidence.

runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Down the field when 18-1 for her Lingfield debut (7f) but she is bred to do much better
runners.name: Thats Enough
runners.owner: Commercium Ii And Whitsbury Manor Stud
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree but she was a well-beaten 18-1 shot on her Lingfield debut three weeks ago (7f); no surprise to see her leave that well behind in time.

runners.comment: First foal of a 7f AW winner (RPR 72); doesn't have a daunting standard to aim at on debut
runners.name: Faffs Gold
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 7f AW winner (RPR 72); doesn't have a daunting standard to aim at on debut but perhaps one for the longer term.

runners.comment: Hasn't seen it out in two 7f maidens thus far; this is weak though and may do better
runners.name: Bergamo Gold
runners.spotlight: Dropped right away on her Chelmsford debut in August (7f), beaten 12l at the finish; better effort when fifth over C&D two weeks ago but she still finished weakly; could still have more to offer though and this is weak.

runners.comment: 10,000gns half-sister to a winner in Slovakia; stable not known for 2yo success
runners.name: Enchantres
runners.spotlight: 10,000gns yearling; half-sister to a winner in Slovakia; stable not renowned for winning 2yo newcomers.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a 6f novice at Kempton six weeks ago (33-1); blinkers now added
runners.name: Peas And Queues
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a 6f novice at Kempton six weeks ago (33-1); blinkers now added.

runners.comment: 6,000gns half-sister to minor winner Monkey Miss (RPR 68); betting useful on debut
runners.name: Show Me Gold
runners.spotlight: 6,000gns yearling; second foal; half-sister to 5.7f/7f winner Monkey Miss (RPR 68); dam a 5f 2yo winner (70); starts out in a modest event and she needs a market check.

19:00.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Nursery Handicap

runners.comment: C&D win from the front three weeks ago; the only winner in the field; obvious claims
runners.name: Snaafy
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a C&D nursery three weeks ago; 4lb higher today but as the only winner in the field he has to be taken seriously; withdrawn here ten days ago having played up in the stalls.

runners.comment: Improvement required for the new, longer trip, but it is not out of the question
runners.name: Credit Forgedd It
runners.spotlight: He hasn't threatened in two 6f nurseries on Polytrack but this represent a drop in class and the longer trip is worth exploring; notable that he was sent off favourite on his penultimate start; may do better.

runners.comment: Consistent but exposed; needs the new cheekpieces to give him a lift
runners.name: Zipwire
runners.owner: The 19Th Hole Syndicate & J S Moore
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden but regularly placed, including over 9.5f here ten days ago; behind Snaafy on his penultimate start though (pulled hard) and now has cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: 2nd in 7f nursery here in September; well held twice since (6f); up in trip; accesories on
runners.name: Shes Crafty
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing L And Jmr Partners
runners.spotlight: Finished second in a 7f nursery here in September but well held in a couple of 6f runs since; now steps up in distance with accessories fitted.

runners.comment: No impact in three 5f runs; could prove a different proposition up in trip/handicapping
runners.name: Hardstyle
runners.spotlight: No impact in three 5f runs on AW this winter; surprising if he doesn't prove a different proposition now upped in trip and switched to a low-grade nursery.

runners.comment: Some promise on second start (1m); makes nursery debut at a realistic level; check betting
runners.name: Vietnorm
runners.spotlight: Second run wasn't without hope (1m, Tapeta) and he makes his nursery debut at a realistic level; worth a market check.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Ran okay on nursery debut and cheekpieces were absent when down the field latest; new yard
runners.name: Trust No One
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly on his nursery debut at Southwell (1m) in October when cheekpieces were tried for the first time; headgear was left off when down the field back at Southwell four weeks later; now starts out for a new yard with the cheekpieces back on.

runners.comment: Poor form to date; hopes rest on new trip/headgear prompting improvement
runners.name: Elemental
runners.spotlight: Modest form in four runs, the latest his nursery debut; hopes rest on the new trip/headgear sparking some progress.

19:30.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

prev_owners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
Ian Wight, Mrs Teresa Lyons And Ptnr

runners.breeder: Genesis Green Stud & Lady Juliet Tadgell
runners.name: Emery Down
Leeson Street
runners.owner: Ed Babington, Eddie O Leary And Partner

runners.comment: Landed his 12th AW success here eight days ago; admirable sort.
runners.name: Love Your Work

quotes.race: Bombardier Golden Beer Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a unique surface so previous form at the course helps a lot. Love Your Work is declared for Friday and as long as he's all right, he'll run again - Tim Fitzgerald, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Adam said go forward. Love Your Work did have a look, he was a bit lairy in front, but the blinkers have done the job for him. I knew I had to put on a strong gallop. My horse will be better the next time and probably even better dropped back to seven furlongs - Robbie Walsh, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Landed his 12th AW success here (9.5f) eight days ago; now rising ten, he must be an admirable sort to be associated with; must contend with 4lb penalty here but should run his race.

runners.comment: No encouragement when last of nine here 15 days ago on stable debut.
runners.name: Redhot Whisper
runners.spotlight: 0-13 for Ben Brookhouse and changed hands for £5,000 in October; no encouragement when last of nine here (9.5f) 15 days ago on stable debut; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Has three wins over C&D, the latest of those off 5lb lower mark in October.
runners.name: Serious Look
runners.spotlight: Has three wins over C&D, the latest of those off 5lb lower mark in October; beaten three times since but back to his winning distance will help.

runners.comment: Beaten 23l on British debut at Southwell last month; handicap debut.
runners.name: The Corporate Guy
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in two starts for Gavin Cromwell in the autumn; sold for 7,000gns in October but beaten 23l on British debut at Southwell (AW, 1m) last month in first-time hood (removed here); handicap debut but needs to show improvement.

runners.comment: Denied a clear run when having to settle for third here 15 days ago; runs off same mark.
runners.name: Youarenotforgiven
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW have been over C&D, latest of those in October off this mark; denied a clear run when having to settle for third here (8.5f) 15 days ago; runs off same mark and must come into consideration back at his optimum trip.

stable_tour.quote: He won nicely at Leicester last Wednesday over a mile off a mark of 73. He's been to Brighton once but didn't run very well and instead he  could head to the Racing League fixture at Chepstow on Thursday. We'll just see and have a think about it before we decide. 07-08-24

runners.comment: Improver who got up close home for the second time in succession here 17 days ago.
runners.name: Salaria
runners.spotlight: Progressive filly who got up close home for the second time in succession here (8.5f) 17 days ago; the manner of her wins means she does not go up too much in the ratings and she should remain competitive with this step back up in trip also likely to suit.

runners.comment: Won at Lingfield this month and fair third at Kempton 13 days ago.
runners.name: Bownder
runners.spotlight: Returned to winning ways at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) this month and ran respectable third of 11 over a trip that stretched him at Kempton (1m4f) 13 days ago; not out of this but others may be more progressive.

stable_tour.quote: He won a Goodwood handicap in June off 66 and went to Newbury on Friday for a 1m2f apprentice handicap, finishing a half-length second with five lengths back to the third. It was a good run off a mark of 68. He's a reliable sort whose best distance is a mile and a quarter and he'll keep going as long as there's some give in the ground. 20-08-25

runners.comment: Won twice on AW but neither run for his new stable suggests he is the answer today.
runners.name: Riyadh Gem
runners.spotlight: Won two handicaps on AW when trained by Archie Watson but neither run for his new stable suggests he is the answer today.

runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Got off the mark at the 22nd attempt when awarded the race over C&D this month.
runners.name: Rating
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the 22nd attempt when awarded the race over C&D this month; below that form when eighth of 12 over C&D 17 days ago off 4lb higher; her poor win record makes her hard to fancy.

runners.comment: 0-9; steps up in trip and Holly Doyle rides for the first time.
runners.name: The Sweet Escape
runners.spotlight: Yet to get off the mark in nine attempts; different headgear worn on last two starts are dispensed with; steps up in trip and Holly Doyle rides for the first time; may be worth another chance.

runners.comment: Has not been beaten far on his two runs here this month and should not be far away.
runners.name: First Greyed
runners.spotlight: Has not been beaten far on his two runs here this month and Billy Loughnane, who rode him to victory here in April now takes over; steps back up in trip and should not be far away.

runners.comment: 0-6 but ran his best race to date when headed in the final strides over C&D 29 days ago.
runners.name: Token Love
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but ran his best race to date when headed in the final strides over C&D (25-1) 29 days ago; should be in the mix if he can reproduce that effort.

20:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Speedy front-runner; bolted up at Lingfield latest; well in under penalty but drawn widest
runners.name: Sams Xpress

quotes.race: Happy St Patrick's Weekend Handicap
quotes.quote: Sam's Xpress has loads of boot, piles of boot. He showed a nice bit last year but had a bit of trouble with sore shins and that. He could turn out next week in a three-year-old only handicap at Naas - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Back to his best for this yard, winning three of his seven starts (including C&D) since joining the stable in the summer; bolted up at Lingfield last week and looks well in under a penalty but he does have the outside stall to negotiate here.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and ran well over C&D four days ago; drawn higher than ideal this time
runners.name: Phoenix Beach
runners.spotlight: Well suited by the conditions and he wasn't beaten far into fourth over C&D on Saturday despite getting bumped by a rival in the home straight; lower draw would have been preferable but not ruled out.

runners.comment: 11-race maiden; has shown promise over C&D; needs more to break her duck though
runners.name: Peregrine Falcon
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; effective over C&D and edging down the weights; could still have a bigger effort in her but she missed an intended run on Boxing Day due to a bruised foot.

runners.comment: Beaten 17 times since a York novice win last summer; threatening in 6f handicaps of late
runners.name: Havana Gila
runners.spotlight: Won a fillies' novice at York on her second start but beaten 17 times since; more encouragement in 6f handicaps on her last two starts and could prove suited by this drop back to 5f.

runners.comment: Three turf wins this year; solid efforts in defeat on AW on last two starts; not ruled out
runners.name: Son Of Astar
runners.spotlight: Three wins on turf this season and he has run solid races in defeat in AW handicaps on his last two starts; likely he will need a pace collapse to win around here but that is not out of the question given the make up of the race.

stable_tour.quote: We've only got five or six juveniles. He's the one who's the most forward, the rest are a little bit slow to come to hand. He was fifth the other day when topweight in a nursery at Leicester behind Tees Aggregates. He ran okay but the ground was probably a bit quick for him. He's been fourth a couple of two-year-old before the season's end.times too and I'm pretty sure he'll win as a 07-08-24

runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Gone the wrong way this year; down in weights but not firing of late; new headgear today
runners.name: Captain Kinsella

prev_owners.owner: Optimumracing Co Uk & Andrew P Bell

runners.spotlight: Looked promising last winter but he has gone the wrong way this year, including when prominent in the betting on his last three runs; 7l to find with Sam's Xpress on last week's Lingfield run; new headgear now tried.

runners.comment: Won 3 of his last 4; well drawn and looks booked for another big effort
runners.name: Alafdhal

quotes.race: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap
quotes.quote: They went hard up front which helped Alafdhal and the race fell apart. That's four from four around here now and he's done well to come through as he has had his health issues and has also had me running him over the wrong trip - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Thriving this winter and arrives having won three of his last four starts (second on the other); up 3lb for the latest but well drawn and no obvious reason why he wouldn't go well.

runners.comment: Made all over C&D early in the month; only fourth off this mark last week
runners.name: Street Life
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Apprentice Training Series Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I let Street Life bowl along and as soon as I asked him, he just took off. Last time I rode him, he missed the break and it was game over. He was a lot more relaxed in the stalls - Morgan Cole, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Where The Nation Plays Handicap
quotes.quote: He has done it well. STREET LIFE was away really well and jumped the best of them. He travelled as well, whereas before he was always lazy in his racing. He put it to bed well - Sean Davis, jockey

runners.spotlight: He had been threatening prior to his front-running C&D win on December 1; only fourth off his revised mark here last week and other pace to deal with this time.

runners.comment: Promising stable debut after long absence last month; pulled his chance away latest
runners.name: Hes An Angel
runners.spotlight: Thrown in on his form two winters ago and he made an encouraging start for this yard over 6f here last month (after 13 months off); pulled his chance away at Southwell 12 days ago but a strongly run 5f could help and he remains of interest.

runners.comment: Two encouraging runs for his new stable; should be arriving on the scene late
runners.name: Amerjeet
runners.spotlight: He has dropped a long way in the weights and both runs for new stable have been encouraging; unable to reward strong support last time but it was still his best run for some time and Billy Loughnane retains the ride; more appealing than many.
